=== === === === === == = - - = == === === === === === . . Private Fields . === === === === === == = - - = == === === === === ===
As much as I hate to make code less optimized, static readonly T Instance was replaced with parameter to allow configuration modifications (not supported yet (TODO: this)).
As much as I want to simply use a readonly field with static initializer here, we need a null check to support full runtime engine reloading and reference modification. Note: If we will ever have engine that does not support runtime reloading - use static readonly fields instead.

member.name: E:Eclipse.Engine.OnEngineResetting
member.summary: Called when every existing instance of and similar is fully unloaded.
member.remarks: Used to reset static references to the old services and configuration classes, as to prevent memory leaks on mod reloading.

members.member: TODO: References the entire tree of parents of given service to itself, so retrieving, So retrieving, for example, replaced will yield you a reference of a replacement.

=== === === === === == = - - = == === === === === === . . Public Methods . === === === === === == = - - = == === === === === ===
Method is extremely optimized for a repeated usage. Feel free to use it very frequently.
However, using generic is even better.
Can be used in method, but service might not be initialized depending on .
Will throw if requested was not created on initialization. Use '' or '' if you need to handle missing services more gracefully.

=== === === === === == = - - = == === === === === === . . Fetching and Loading . === === === === === == = - - = == === === === === ===
Unloads assemblies and classes from the memory.
Will cache resources like textures, atlases, music and etc. in case it will be referenced again. Will use update date and time to decide whether to update a resource or not.

member.name: M:Eclipse.EngineService.Unload

member.name: T:Eclipse.Modding.Mod
member.summary: Class describes all the mod data it can have. AssetBundles, assemblies, and other resources are described here with wrappers around dictionaries and resource addresses.
member.remarks:
You are free to develop mods for the game, but they won't be used in public events before approval. Approval requires you to expose mod code to the public, and make the last update 2-3 days before the event (in most cases). Our team will go through the code and verify its contents.
If mod was already verified and you have a hotfix - we can make a quick verification, but you need to contact out team for that. This section applies only to those, who's mods were selected for usage in any of the upcoming events.
Keep in mind that ALL the mods that use BepInEx and Harmony will be disqualified outside of the special cases. If your mod is large enough, we will consider verifying it, but otherwise - they won't be accepted. And it doesn't matter that we have a support for BepInEx and Harmony in code - it was made for ease in modding, not for our public events. Refer to the modding guide to grasp all the tools available for you as a mod-maker by default (that's a lot btw, with native C# support, dw)
TL;DR:
- Try to use native modding tools for creating verifiable code instead of BepInEx and Harmony.
- Contact us to request new features.
- BepInEx and Harmony mods wont be accepted (for events) outside of special circumstances. (This message is from Dark)

member.name: P:Eclipse.ServiceAfterloadMethodAttribute.ThreadSafe
member.summary: Whether method can be executed in a background thread.

Flag is ignored if target has flag set on it. In which case method will be executed on a main thread instead.
Regardless of being executed in a background or on a main thread, will still only run after 's method.

member.name: P:Eclipse.ServiceAttribute.ThreadExecutionOrder
member.summary: If thread-safe - will be initialized in a background thread.
member.remarks:
Thread-safe code is one that does not access any other service, for example. Important! This will NOT force and to run in background. Those will still execute on a main thread, before and after service multi-threaded initialization.
Only select any other than if you know what you are doing.

member.name: T:Eclipse.Structs.FullCategory
member.summary: Category of an or any other thing. It is used to provide automatic categorization and some utils for external settings editing, but does not affect serialization (since values of is serialize based only on ) (see also: )
member.remarks:
Categorization is also used to automatically generate settings UI for mods. Parameters that were implemented on the UI manually, anywhere, will not be automatically generated.
Note: flag does not affect whether paratemeter will be visible
And if you plan on manually exposing the parameter later-on with a menu.

member.name: F:Eclipse.Structs.FullCategory.SplitOrderRange
member.summary: Range which covers a specific block on the Settings UI before a split-line is created. For example - default region covers [-500_000 : 500_000], the one or the right: [500_001 : 1000_000], and left: [-1000_000 : -500_001]

member.name: F:Eclipse.Structs.FullCategory.Visible
member.summary: Whether this parameter is visible or not.
member.remarks: Does not affect category visibility - it is automatically set to be "Visible" when any parameter in it is visible. Use with to hide it.

member.name: F:Eclipse.Structs.FullCategory.Order
member.summary: Order of this parameter in the category.
member.remarks: A split-line between parameters will be created on UI if order will be inside a different . (see also: ) // TODO: Update the reference to the Settings UI. (see docs for more info)
